{{Infobox cricket team |county = Sialkot Cricket Team |image = [[File:Sialkot Stallions.png|175px]] |oneday = [[Sialkot Stallions]] |coach = [[Shahid Anwar]] |captain = [[Shoaib Malik]] |overseas = |founded = 2002 |ground = [[Jinnah Stadium (Sialkot)]] |capacity = 20,000 |fcdebutvs = [[Sheikhupura]] |fcdebutyr = 2002 |fcdebutvenue = [http://www.cricketarchive.com/Archive/Grounds/22/1529.html Lahore Country Club] | title1 = [[Quaid-i-Azam Trophy]] | title1wins = 2 | title2 = [[National One-day Championship]] | title2wins = 2 | title3 = [[Twenty-20 Cup]] | title3wins = 5 | title4 = | title4wins = |website = [[Sialkot Stallions|Sialkot Cricket Team]] }}
The '''[[Sialkot]] cricket team''' in [[Pakistan]] is also known as the [[Sialkot]] Stallions. Its home ground is [[Jinnah Stadium Sialkot]]. It plays in [[first-class cricket|first-class]] domestic competitions. It is a National Champion and has won several [[Quaid-i-Azam Trophy]] competitions including 2008-2009. It was national champion in 2005â2006 and won [[Quaid-i-Azam Trophy]] Championship (Golden League) . It was runner-up in 2003â2004 and 2006â2007. Sialkot Stallions also won [[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup]] in 2005â2006, 2006â2007 and [[Twenty-20 Cup|RBS Twenty-20 Cup]] in 2007â2008 and 2009â2010, making them the National Twenty20 Champions for 4 consecutive years . Sialkot Stallions were to represent Pakistan in [[Twenty20 Champions League]] in December 2008, before its postponement. They were runner-up in [[ABN-AMRO Cup National One-day Championship]] in 2004â05 and 2006â07. According to the latest Twenty 20 international ranking, [[Sialkot Stallions]] is at number one position. Sialkot is also the national champion of One-day and Three-day competitions of the National Under-19 Championship. They also have a record of 23 consecutive T20 wins in domestic cricket<ref name="Record ">{{cite web|url=http://stats.cricinfo.com/ci/content/records/305308.html|title=Records / Twenty20 matches / Team records / Most consecutive wins|publisher=Cricinfo|accessdate=2009-11-04}}</ref>
Noted players in recent years include [[Imran Nazir]], [[Shoaib Malik]], [[Naved-ul-Hasan]] and [[Mohammad Asif]].
==2007â08 Squad==
Sialkot play in silver and red kit. The captain of Sialkot is the all rounder [[Shoaib Malik]]. The best player of local teams is Hussain Gujjar who taught Shoaib Malik cricket. Sialkot lost their Two main cricketers Imran Nazir and Rana Naveed to Icl.
The captain of Sialkot Stallions Shoaib Malik captained the Pakistan National Team
In the 2007â08 season, the following players represented Sialkot <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Jinnah Cricket Stadium4.jpg|200px|right|thumb|[[Jinnah Stadium (Sialkot)]], Home ground of Sialkot Stallions]] --> <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Stallion 1.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Sialkot Stallions after victory in RBC [[Twenty-20 Cup]] 2008]] --> <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Stallion 2.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Sialkot Stallions victory march after victory in RBC [[Twenty-20 Cup]] 2008]] --> <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:SialkotStallionsMatch.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Sialkot Stallions Batting during domestic cricket]] --> <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:SialkotStallionsPractice.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Sialkot Stallions fitness session before the game]] --> <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Sialkot Quaid i Azam Trophy.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Sialkot Cricket Team after winning [[Quaid-i-Azam Trophy]]]] -->
